required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Safety and Pharmacokinetics of MMX Mesalamine in Children and Adolescents With Ulcerative Colitis
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase 1, Multicenter, Open-label Study to Determine the Safety and Pharmacokinetics of MMX Mesalamine Following Administration in Children and Adolescents With Ulcerative Colitis

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to determine the safety and pharmacokinetics of MMX mesalamine following administration in children and adolescents with ulcerative colitis.

primary_outcome.measure: Area Under the Plasma Concentration Versus Time Curve (AUC) of MMX Mesalamine (5-ASA) at Steady State
primary_outcome.description: AUC can be used as a measure of drug exposure. It is derived from drug concentration and time so it gives a measure how much and how long a drug stays in a body.

primary_outcome.measure: Maximum Plasma Concentration (Cmax) of MMX Mesalamine (5-ASA) at Steady State
primary_outcome.time_frame: Over a 24-hour period starting on day 7
primary_outcome.description: Cmax is a term that refers to the maximum (or peak) concentration that a drug achieves in the body after the drug has been administrated.

primary_outcome.measure: Time to Maximum Plasma Concentration (Tmax) of MMX Mesalamine (5-ASA) at Steady State
primary_outcome.time_frame: Over a 24-hour period starting on day 7
primary_outcome.description: Tmax is the time after administration of a drug when the maximum plasma concentration in the body is reached.

primary_outcome.measure: Total Body Clearance (CL) of MMX Mesalamine (5-ASA) at Steady State
primary_outcome.time_frame: Over a 24-hour period starting on day 7
primary_outcome.description: Clearance of a substance from the blood by the kidneys.

primary_outcome.measure: AUC of MMX Mesalamine Major Metabolite (Ac-5-ASA) at Steady State
Cmax of MMX Mesalamine Major Metabolite (Ac-5-ASA) at Steady State
primary_outcome.time_frame: Over a 24-hour period starting on day 7

primary_outcome.measure: Tmax of MMX Mesalamine Major Metabolite (Ac-5-ASA) at Steady State
primary_outcome.time_frame: Over a 24-hour period starting on day 7

primary_outcome.measure: CL of MMX Mesalamine Major Metabolite (Ac-5-ASA) at Steady State
primary_outcome.time_frame: Over a 24-hour period starting on day 7

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Dose Absorbed For MMX Mesalamine (5-ASA) in Urine at Steady State
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Over a 24-hour period starting on day 7
secondary_outcome.description: The percentage of the dose absorbed was calculated as: 100 x (Xu0-24h 5-ASA + [0.7847* Xu0-24h Ac-5-ASA])/dose, where 0.7847 is the ratio of the molecular weight of 5-ASA (153.14) to the molecular weight of Ac-5-ASA (195.15). Xu0-24h is equal to the cumulative amount recovered in urine in the time interval of 0 to 24 hours.

secondary_outcome.measure: Cumulative Amount of MMX Mesalamine (5-ASA) Recovered in Urine at Steady State
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Over a 24-hour period starting on day 7

secondary_outcome.measure: Cumulative Amount of MMX Mesalamine Major Metabolite (Ac-5-ASA) Recovered in Urine at Steady State
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Over a 24-hour period starting on day 7

intervention.description: 30 mg/kg/day of MMX Mesalamine tablets, dosed once daily for 7 days.
60 mg/kg/day of MMX Mesalamine tablets, dosed once daily for 7 days.
100 mg/kg/day of MMX Mesalamine tablets, dosed once daily for 7 days.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. Subjects aged 5-17 years, with appropriately obtained informed consent and assent.
2. Subject has a documented history of ulcerative colitis for at least 3 months.
3. Subjects who are currently on 5-ASA or product(s) containing or metabolized to mesalamine must have been on a stable regimen for at least 4 weeks prior to first dose of investigational medicinal product.
4. Subjects who are not currently on a drug regimen, or on a 5-ASA or product containing or metabolized to mesalamine, must have been on a stable regimen for at least 4 weeks prior to first dose at least 4 weeks prior first dose of investigational medicinal product.
5. Body weight of 18kg-82kg inclusive.
Exclusion Criteria:
1. Current or recurrent disease (eg cardiovascular, renal, liver, malignancy or other conditions) that could affect the colon, the action, absorption or disposition of the IMP, or clinical or laboratory assessments with the exception of their existing ulcerative colitis.
2. Ulcerative Colitis known to be confined to the rectum (isolated rectal proctitis).
3. Any history of hepatic impairment or moderate to severe renal impairment.
4. The use of systemic or rectal steroids within the last 4 weeks, immunomodulators within the last 6 weeks, biologics within 6 months, antibiotic use within the last 7 days prior to the first dose of investigational medicinal product.

Klinika Pediatrii Gastroenterologii i Zywienia, Uniwersytecki Szpital Dzieciecy w Krakowie

Oddzial Gastroenterologii i Hepatologii, Instytut Pomnik-Centrum Zdrowia Dziecka
Alder Hey Children's NHS Foundation Trust
Barts Health NHS Trust/Royal London Hospital
Somers Clinical Research Facility/Great Ormond Street Hospital

outcome.title: Area Under the Plasma Concentration Versus Time Curve (AUC) of MMX Mesalamine (5-ASA) at Steady State
outcome.description: AUC can be used as a measure of drug exposure. It is derived from drug concentration and time so it gives a measure how much and how long a drug stays in a body.
outcome.population: The Pharmacokinetic Set (PKS) consisted of all subjects in the Safety Analysis Set who generated sufficient plasma samples to allow reliable determination of Cmax and AUC. The Safety Analysis Set consisted of subjects who took at least 1 dose of investigational product and had at least 1 post-dose safety assessment.

measure.description: AUC can be used as a measure of drug exposure. It is derived from drug concentration and time so it gives a measure how much and how long a drug stays in a body.
measure.population: The Pharmacokinetic Set (PKS) consisted of all subjects in the Safety Analysis Set who generated sufficient plasma samples to allow reliable determination of Cmax and AUC. outcome.title: Percentage of Dose Absorbed For MMX Mesalamine (5-ASA) in Urine at Steady State
outcome.description: The percentage of the dose absorbed was calculated as: 100 x (Xu0-24h 5-ASA + [0.7847* Xu0-24h Ac-5-ASA])/dose, where 0.7847 is the ratio of the molecular weight of 5-ASA (153.14) to the molecular weight of Ac-5-ASA (195.15). Xu0-24h is equal to the cumulative amount recovered in urine in the time interval of 0 to 24 hours.
outcome.time_frame: Over a 24-hour period starting on day 7

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: If a multicenter publication is not submitted within twelve (12) months after conclusion, abandonment or termination of the Study at all sites, or after Sponsor confirms there shall be no multicenter Study publication, the Institution and/or such Principal Investigator may publish the results from the Institution site individually.
